Tavatron broke off a few more twigs then doubled back to a stream she had 
spied earlier. The fog had thickened to the point where her beast mode 
optics could barely see.

"Maximize!" Tavatron whispered. She transformed, careful not to disturb her 
newly laid trail. Tavatron switched to infer-red mode and did a quick scan 
of the area. (with her eyes, not her scanners. that would be cheating.)

Tavatron kneeled beside the stream as she began to calculate how fast she 
would need to run in order to clear it. She backed up a few yards then began 
to run. She jumped over the stream, barely clearing it.

She stood on the other side a moment, catching her breath. *The things I do 
to lay a false trail. At least he won't be able to follow my scent over the 
river.* She thought to herself. Tavatron sniffed the air twice, then let 
loose a wild hunting howl.

*You're in my world now, let's see how long you last.*

>From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>

>Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars

>
>
>* The moon was high and that gave off just enough light to see by as 
>Dinobot
>made his way through the forest. He could hear wild animal calls such as
>elk, moose, squirel and even a bear, filter in through the trees.
>A light mist had developed among the massive tree trunks, almost making 
>this
>event seem like out of a horror movie and Tavatron and himself were the
>stars! However, horror was Dinobot's middle name.
>He was still following Tavatron's sent through the trees but it was
>beginning to get old, which meant that she was gaining ground and was far
>ahead of him.
>Dinobot kept a watch out, not only for Predacons but also for female bots
>who decided to circle around and get the drop on him.
>He snarled when he noticed that Tavatron's sent had suddenly disappeared,
>now it was down to the basics in order to track her down.
>Dinobot looked around and saw a bent twig, he walked over and sniffed at 
>it.
>Tavatron!
>Dinobot snarled deeply, she wouldn't leave such an obvious sign to her
>passing unless...she was toying with him! She was playing a game, the
>title... Track Me If You Can!
>Soon the clues would become harder to recognise and eventually disappear,
>this was probably part of their practice battle.
>Dinobot looked up slowly and grinned to himself, he could play this game
>too!*
>
